transcript_segments.text: As-salamu alaykum. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. A special recipe for a special occasion. Eid is near, so let’s make a delicious original degi Sindhi Biryani, as requested.
Avoid packaged spice mixes for this Eid. We’ll make a tasty degi Sindhi Biryani with fresh spices, just like in big pots, with great aroma and flavor, using an easy method. Let’s start the recipe.
I’m using Falak brand rice, but you can also use sela rice. Wash the rice well and soak in clean water for about 15 minutes.

instruction: Peel and cut potatoes in halves. Rinse and pat them dry.
title: Prepare Potatoes

transcript_segments.text: Since it’s Sindhi Biryani, I’ll boil the potatoes. I’ve taken 5 medium-sized potatoes, peeled, cleaned, and cut one into two pieces as per degi style.

instruction: Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the potato halves until golden brown. Remove and set aside.

instruction: In a large pot, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, black peppercorns, cloves, cardamoms, cinnamon, and bay leaf. Fry for 30-40 seconds until fragrant.
title: Heat Oil and Fry Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Now moving on, either take a pressure cooker for quicker biryani or an open pot like I use. Add one cup of oil or melted ghee. Slice five medium onions.

instruction: Add sliced onions to the pot. Fry them on medium heat until deep golden brown, stirring occasionally.
title: Add and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: We’ll use these fried onions while layering biryani. Add a little water to stop browning, spread on a tissue to dry, and keep aside.

instruction: Add chopped tomatoes to the browned onions. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture thickens.
title: Cook Tomatoes

transcript_segments.text: We’ll use these fried onions while layering biryani. Add a little water to stop browning, spread on a tissue to dry, and keep aside.

instruction: Add the marinated meat along with all the marinade to the pot. Stir well to combine with the onion-tomato base.
title: Add Marinated Meat

transcript_segments.text: We’ll use these fried onions while layering biryani. Add a little water to stop browning, spread on a tissue to dry, and keep aside.
Now for the meat: I’m using 1.25 kg of goat meat with bone for richer flavor. Add ginger garlic paste.
Add 5–6 green cardamoms, 1 tbsp whole white cumin, 3 black cardamoms, 2 star anise, and small cinnamon sticks.
Add 1 tbsp crushed red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, and 1 tbsp salt (adjust to taste), and ½ tbsp ground spices.
Chicken powder is essential; I use Dashi brand. Add 3 medium chopped tomatoes. Skip chicken powder if desired.
Add ½ cup yogurt and 7–8 dried plums. Add 4 chopped green chilies or 1 tbsp paste.
Fry this mixture well to enhance the aroma and taste. Frying removes any meat smell.
Add 3½ glasses of water for the meat to tenderize. Add ¼ tsp yellow food color for authentic degi biryani look.
Cover the pot and simmer on low heat for 1 to 1¼ hours until meat is soft. Prepare the fresh herb mix for layering.

instruction: Cover and cook the meat on medium heat until tender and oil separates from the masala. Add water as needed during cooking.
title: Cook Meat Until Tender

transcript_segments.text: Cover the pot and simmer on low heat for 1 to 1¼ hours until meat is soft. Prepare the fresh herb mix for layering.

instruction: Mix in coriander powder and garam masala powder. Cook for a few more minutes to deepen the flavor.
title: Add Powdered Spices

transcript_segments.text: Add ½ tsp homemade saffron garam masala, ¼ tsp mace powder, ¼ tsp nutmeg powder, and ½ tsp chaat masala.
Add chopped coriander and mint. Save some for the final layering. Mix well; herb mix is ready.
Set aside the herb mix. The meat has cooked well over 1.5 hours. It’s perfectly tender now.
Mix the curry and potatoes so they absorb flavor. Now add the prepared herb mix.
Move the masala to the side of the pot to avoid burning. Keep meat, potatoes, and masala to the side.
Add 1.5 tbsp oil on top of the curry. The korma is ready. Now let’s boil the rice.

instruction: Add the fried potatoes, chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves, and slit green chilies. Stir gently to blend.
title: Add Fried Potatoes and Herbs

transcript_segments.text: In boiling water, add 1 tbsp cumin, 1 black cardamom, 6–7 cloves, 2 bay leaves, 1 small cinnamon stick, and 10–12 black pepper.

instruction: Rinse the basmati rice in water 2-3 times. Soak in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: Boil the rice on high heat until slightly undercooked—only 3–5 minutes. Start the timer when water boils.

instruction: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add salt generously.
title: Boil Water for Rice

transcript_segments.text: Boil the rice on high heat until slightly undercooked—only 3–5 minutes. Start the timer when water boils.

instruction: Add soaked rice to boiling water. Cook until 70-80% done. Drain and keep aside.
title: Cook Rice Partially

transcript_segments.text: Boil the rice on high heat until slightly undercooked—only 3–5 minutes. Start the timer when water boils.

instruction: In a large heavy-bottomed pot, spread half of the cooked rice at the bottom.
title: Start Layering

instruction: Spread the cooked meat masala with potatoes evenly over the rice layer.
title: Add Meat Mixture

transcript_segments.text: Boil the rice on high heat until slightly undercooked—only 3–5 minutes. Start the timer when water boils.

instruction: Add the remaining rice on top. Gently level it out.
title: Top Final Rice Layer

Check if rice is long and soft with a slight bite. That’s the sign to stop.
Now layer all the rice on top of the curry. Add dark yellow food color for tri-color look. Add fried onions.

instruction: Drizzle saffron milk on top. Sprinkle remaining mint, coriander, and some reserved fried onions if available.
title: Add Final Garnish

transcript_segments.text: Now layer all the rice on top of the curry. Add dark yellow food color for tri-color look. Add fried onions.

instruction: Seal the pot with a tight-fitting lid or dough. Place on low heat and cook for 20-25 minutes for dum (steam) cooking.
title: Seal and Dum Cook

instruction: Let the biryani rest for 10 minutes after cooking. Gently fluff and mix before serving with raita or salad.
